timeline.message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into replace_deprecated

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/resources/l10n/JabRef_en.properties

timeline.bodyText: I think the old actions here can be completely removed
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: I'm afraid this does not work as the MergeEntriesAction is initialized with a given database (the base panel that was open when JabRef was started). Thus, even through the action is invoked from a different database it would merge entries in the original db. Hopefully it is enough to use the statemanger in MergeEntriesAction to get the current database.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -748,7 +752,7 @@ private MenuBar createMenu() {
 
         quality.getItems().addAll(
                 factory.createMenuItem(StandardActions.FIND_DUPLICATES, new DuplicateSearch(this, dialogService, stateManager)),
-                factory.createMenuItem(StandardActions.MERGE_ENTRIES, new MergeEntriesAction(this, stateManager)),
+                factory.createMenuItem(StandardActions.MERGE_ENTRIES, new MergeEntriesAction(this.getCurrentBasePanel(), dialogService, stateManager)),

replies.bodyText:
I wonder if there is an architectural problem in BasePanel: BibDatabase::insertEntry does not contain logic to mark the BasePanel as changed and to mark entries with a timestamp, only BasePanel::insertEntry does.
Would require some more refactoring. 😅
replies.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText: I put a comment in the code about this issue, but this is something that would need a solution / decision before merging.
replies.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText: Ahh yeah, the insertEntry needs refactoring indeed. For the moment, it should suffice to pass the jabref frame as a parameter to the action and then get the current base panel in the exectue method
replies.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: Is this line here on purpose? It doesn't seem to make much sense as the action is not relative to the currently selected entry.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: I think entry.getFields().stream().anyMatch(fields::contains) is slightly better performance wise (as disjoint needs to check if all elements of fields are not contained in entry.getFields())
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: This can be written a bit more elegantly now using the isAnyFieldSet method, right?
timeline.author: tobiasdiez
